result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Andrew Herman

records.addlTxt: Granted.  Further proceedings currently scheduled is not a hearing before the court; it is only an offer deadline for the DA's office.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
10:53 a.m.  Defendant in person; all else via Zoom.  No inducement.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  10/28/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 2:31 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Paul Andrew Herman in court. Attorney Ann Larson appearing with the defendant.  Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 07-28-22 at 10:30 a.m. Br. 3.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of 2 cts. theft.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-20-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $10,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Austin Veselak or the business Spartech Polycom and its premises at 2917 Division Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220.  He must also have no contact with any scrap/metal purchasing business.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 06-03-2022
